elements.title: Franklin Street Terminal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Franklin Street Terminal (tracks pictured) was constructed by gutting two floors of two buildings and running elevated tracks into the resulting void?

elements.title: set on Boxing Day 1920 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the attendance record for a women's club football game that was set on Boxing Day 1920 would not be exceeded for 99 years?

elements.title: Benjamin F. Gue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Benjamin F. Gue, who co-founded Iowa State University, allowed women to become students there despite much opposition?

elements.title: Misa sine nomine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Leon Schidlowsky wrote the Misa sine nomine in memory of Víctor Jara for speaker, choirs, organ and percussion, juxtaposing mass texts with contemporary poetry and Torah verses?

elements.title: Justly Watson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Justly Watson died suddenly in 1757 from the effects of poison administered in his coffee, it was believed, by a servant?

elements.title: CMS Enhancements (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that hard drive reseller CMS Enhancements nearly went bankrupt while attempting to enter the personal computer systems market amid a price war?

elements.title: Ann Howard (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that author Ann Howard interviewed more than 100 Australians about their experiences as child evacuees sent inland during World War II when a Japanese invasion seemed imminent?

elements.title: Prince Bernhard's titi monkey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Prince Bernhard's titi monkey is known locally as zog-zog?
